description: This almost never an independent stop, being much too high-pitched, but is rather a Mixture rank. It sounds the 10th harmonic, at 4/5' for the 8' harmonic series, or 1-3/5' for the 16' harmonic series. It is a third-sounding rank. Irwin claims: �it approximates the tenth natural harmonic ... and sounds the E4 from middle C�. Irwin is wrong. It speaks exactly the 10th harmonic, which only approximates an E when played from a C key.
examplesDescription: No examples of Vigesima Quarta or Vigessima-quarta are known. Contributions welcome. All known examples of the other names are listed below.

examples.name: Twenty Fourth 4/5', Great-Solo and Choir-Swell; Convention Hall, Atlantic City, New Jersey, USA; Midmer-Losh. (Unified with several other 3rd-sounding stops.)
Kleinterz 1-3/5', Oberwerk; Ulm, Muenster, Germany; Walcker 1969.
Octave Tierce 4/5', Positive; Durham Cathedral, Durham, England; Harrison & Harrison 1970.
